files.description: Deterministic CI/QA entrypoint that generates required scaffold, runs the canonical QA command, enforces the /outputs-only write policy, and writes QA_REPORT.json to /outputs.
Utility that scans the repository after QA execution and fails if any new/modified files are written outside the canonical outputs tree with allowlist support.
Creates and normalizes the canonical /outputs directory structure and required placeholder files to make the harness deterministic.
GitHub Actions workflow that runs the harness on every push/PR and on a scheduled cadence, uploads outputs/QA_REPORT.json as an artifact, and fails on QA gate or invalid writes.
Config declaring the canonical QA command, outputs root, write-policy allowlists, and report/artifact paths for consistent CI and local runs.
Keeps the canonical outputs directory tracked so CI and local runs have a stable artifact root.
Documentation describing how to run the CI/QA harness locally and in CI, interpret QA_REPORT.json, and troubleshoot write-policy failures.

missionDescription: Create a CI/regression safeguard that runs the canonical QA command on every change (or on a scheduled cadence) and stores QA_REPORT.json as an artifact; fail CI if QA gate fails or if outputs are written outside the canonical /outputs tree.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Even after execution is fixed, the system needs regression protection; current state shows high tool duplication and path drift risk (goal_68), and no CI integration exists to keep QA passing over time.
projectName: CI/regression safeguard that runs the canonical QA command on every change (or on a scheduled cadence) and stores QA_REPORT.json as an artifact; fail CI if QA gate fails or if outputs are written outside the canonical /outputs tree.
